private_information: I can move disks: A, B, C, D, E, F, G, H (A is smallest, H is largest among these).
I must only issue primitive moves for the disks I am allowed to move.
I operate under standard Tower of Hanoi constraints: move one disk at a time; never place a larger disk on top of a smaller disk.
agent_1.goal: Contribute primitive moves for allowed disks so that the global goal configuration is reached.

private_information: I can move disks: I, J, K, L, M, N, O (I is smallest among these, O is largest).
I must only issue primitive moves for the disks I am allowed to move.
I operate under standard Tower of Hanoi constraints: move one disk at a time; never place a larger disk on top of a smaller disk.
agent_2.goal: Contribute primitive moves for allowed disks so that the global goal configuration is reached.

private_information: I integrate the primitive move sequences from agent_1 and agent_2 into a single, consistent plan.
I produce the final PDDL domain and problem files suitable for the FastDownward solver.
I must keep actions of the two agents distinct when encoding them in the multi-agent planning PDDL.
orchestrator.goal: Produce a consolidated PDDL domain and PDDL problem (targeting FastDownward) that encodes the cooperative plan to reach the goal configuration from the initial configuration.

public_information: There are 3 pegs: left, middle, right.
There are 15 disks labeled A (smallest) through O (largest).
Initial configuration (top→bottom) on left peg: A, B, C, D, E, F, G, H, I, J, K, L, M, N, O. Middle and right pegs are empty.
Goal configuration: left peg (top→bottom) A, E, F, G, H, I, J, K, L, M, N, O; middle peg (top→bottom) B, C; right peg (top→bottom) D.
Tower of Hanoi rules apply: only one disk may be moved at a time; a larger disk cannot be placed on top of a smaller disk.
Agent move restrictions: agent_1 may move disks A, B, C, D, E, F, G, H; agent_2 may move disks I, J, K, L, M, N, O.

generate_moves.system_prompt: You are an expert in Tower of Hanoi move sequencing for constrained agents. Your responsibility is to produce a sequence of primitive moves that involve only the disks you are allowed to move (A, B, C, D, E, F, G, H). Do NOT produce PDDL. Ensure every move obeys Tower of Hanoi rules (one disk at a time, never place a larger disk on top of a smaller one). Format each move on its own line exactly as: 'agent_1: move disk X from peg1 to peg2'. Use peg names 'left', 'middle', 'right'. Provide a complete ordered subsequence of moves that concerns only the disks you can move and that is consistent with the public initial state and goal.

You are an expert in Tower of Hanoi move sequencing for constrained agents. Your responsibility is to produce a sequence of primitive moves that involve only the disks you are allowed to move (I, J, K, L, M, N, O). Do NOT produce PDDL. Ensure every move obeys Tower of Hanoi rules (one disk at a time, never place a larger disk on top of a smaller one). Format each move on its own line exactly as: 'agent_2: move disk X from peg1 to peg2'. Use peg names 'left', 'middle', 'right'. Provide a complete ordered subsequence of moves that concerns only the disks you can move and that is consistent with the public initial state and goal.

pddl.system_prompt: You are an expert in multi-agent planning and PDDL encoding for the FastDownward solver. You must integrate the move subsequences provided by agent_1 and agent_2 into a single, consistent PDDL domain and PDDL problem that encodes the initial and goal Tower of Hanoi state and the agent-specific action permissions. Keep the actions of agent_1 and agent_2 distinct (e.g., action names prefixed by agent_1-/agent_2-). Target FastDownward compatibility in the produced PDDL. Enclose the PDDL domain between <domain></domain> tags and the PDDL problem between <problem></problem> tags. If the provided move subsequences are partial, synthesize any remaining necessary actions while respecting agent movement restrictions and Hanoi rules.
